Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

> @LianJilu There are some data that I printed out on the console. The `tooltipDims` should be `["value"]`. The code is [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/src/model/Series.js#L398).
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22974511/71610416-cfa0d180-2bcb-11ea-9ca5-3d1f1a385a39.png)

I find the the tooltipDim of line and bar is also 'y', and the geo is 'lat', pie is 'value', it is seems to be the dimension problem. The Coordinate System Instance has the dimensions and getDimensionsInfo Interface, maybe we should find in it.

If I modify the dimensions of BMapCoordSys, the tooltipDim change to 'value'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25577583/71674205-9330c980-2db5-11ea-94db-43939a4a15c0.png)

@100pah adding a bar start and bar end feature would be very useful in both a waterfall and floating bar chart I've implemented that needs to account for bars that start as negative but end as positive.

> 
> 
> Where is this documented?

It seems there is no documentation for now but you can [check the code](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/4.6.0/src/util/format.js#L191)

can we get this in echarts

This pull request will be closed. Thanks for your contribution. We can have further discussion in https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/pull/11973

Due to file: `src/chart/funnel/FunnelView.js`, `updateData` function, line 105
`polygon.hoverStyle = itemStyleModel.getModel('emphasis').getItemStyle();`
I think this line should be like this:
`polygon.hoverStyle = itemModel.getModel('emphasis').getItemStyle();`

Hi @Conquer369 .

You can run
```js
npm install
npm run build
```

To build the project. It's mainly for the testing. You don't need to submit the built files.

https://echarts.apache.org/zh/changelog.html#v3-7-0

Sorry but there is no way to add markers on the environment map currently

Hi, the ticks will be calculated to be nice numbers after added `boundaryGap`. So the `boundaryGap` is not an accurate value by default. If you want them to be accurate.  Try:
```js
xAxis: {
  min: 'dataMin',
  max: 'dataMax'
}
```

I'm not sure what's your purpose of using `boundaryGap`. For the bar chart. I will suggest you use `category` type axis.
I think it has been fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/pull/11952

éœ€è¦è¾¾åˆ°çš„æ•ˆæœæ˜¯ï¼šä¸­é—´åœ°å›¾åŒºåŸŸç¼©æ”¾ï¼Œå…¶ä»–åŒºåŸŸç»´æŒä¸å˜ã€‚
åŠ æ€¥ï¼Œè°¢è°¢ï¼

This problem is caused by transformed elements with clipPath. See [demo here](https://codepen.io/Ovilia/pen/BayJRPg).
The clipPath position in under global coordinate, but the element is transformed so it doesn't behave as expected.
In order to fix this, we need to create a group element for each transformed element with clipPath and set the clipPath on the group while the element itself is transformed.
We cannot find an easy way to fix this by now, so it's marked to be fixed later.

for instance, a 'W' pattern of candlestick chart (or 'M' type'), 'higher-high' or 'lower-low' happens.
so where would you like to go further after your 'highest' or 'lowest'?

solution:
in the file of echarts.min.js, the order of OHLC array need to be reordered, it is quite easy.
0123 - > 0321, that's it. 
and in tooltip translation and display need to be fixed.

Thanks for the comment. If you go to the JSFiddle in the OP and remove `boundaryGap` line, you get this overflow:

![Ekran gÃ¶rÃ¼ntÃ¼sÃ¼ (2020 01 07, 18_14_22)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/844008/71905612-8f1bf780-3179-11ea-981d-38238a1fcc0a.png)

`dataMin`and `dataMax` doesn't fix it. In order to fix it I wanted to use `boundaryGap`. Or maybe it should be fixed by the echarts algorithm? [Here is](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/11374#issuecomment-570085191) another discussion on the issue. My humble opinion is, if there is no conflicting reason, `boundaryGap` should be absolute. Or maybe there may be a config option to make it absolute?

> I will suggest you use category type axis.

Yes, bar charts are usually used with category axis, but surely there may be cases where it's better a value axis.
Thanks for your suggestion, we will deal with it as soon as possible.

What about `formatter: function(value, index, formatSuggestion) {}` ?

`formatSuggestion` would be strings like `hour_minute_second`, `month_day_hour_minute`, `year_month_day`. Consider it whatever the format current auto-label-formatter mechanism produces. User function receives it as a suggestion and either applies or not.

Is there an update or a milestone release for resolution of this issue (and the three related reports)?

This is not a "performance" issue, it's a critical issue that prevents production deployment of applications.  Could we please mark it as such?

This issue is critical to all deployments of echarts.  The only work-around is to periodically close out a browser completely, or reboot the whole computer system.  It's most obvious in any application that dynamically refreshes charts and which is expected to run constantly, but ALL echarts applications are suffering because of these memory leaks.  We committed to echarts expecting such a critical issue to be resolved fairly quickly, but #7002 was reported more than 2 years ago and there seems to be no progress.

We - [ErgoTech](http://ergotech.com) - would really like to release our product with ECharts charts, but the memory leaks (#10130, #9437, #8988, #7002) are absolute blockers for us.  They mean you cannot create any application that needs to create dynamic charts in an application where the browser or computer are not being restarted on a regular basis.  For us, the application must run without issue for months at a time, with charts refreshing every few seconds, and can't because of these issues.

Hi @ergouser Can you create a new issue and provide your reproducible demo to us? We can't reproduce  the memory leak issue from the code in https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/7002 and the link in this issue has been broken
